comment: Very good professor. Very straight forward. Directly states the information he wants you to learn, and will quiz from the directly stated information. If you have any questions he will answer them swiftly and clearly.
Passionate professor and I really enjoyed his content. Very unique and interesting. Only 4 grades which were the tests, but the material for it is given to you. Very easy if you apply yourself.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Van Horne was very clear with grading criteria in his online Anth 1102 class. It was basically read a chapter, take a quiz..every week. No midterm, no final, no essays...just reading and quizzes every week. Overall it was a very easy course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Wayne Van Horne's class is one of the most interesting courses I've taken. The only teaching style he employs is lecture, but his lectures are interesting and attendance is not required. The grades are 4 open note tests, but questions are pulled directly from provided lecture question and online tests. Get his class if it is available.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took this class online and it was SO HARD. Overall, there was about 3 hours of work required each week to prepare for the weekly open-note quizzes, but even after studying, most of the quiz questions were impossible to find in my notes. Extra credit was not an option and it was extremely difficult to get in contact with him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I love his class so much! I'm virtual, so I've never met him, but I can tell he cares. I missed a quiz due to illness and he was kind enough to let me take it anyways. He gives very concise notes on the topics in each module. The weekly quizzes are open-note/open-book and are the only grade for the class. No midterms, finals, or papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: A lot of reading and quizzes weekly. The quizzes are based on the PowerPoint and book chapters so as long as you read them and take some notes you will pass with a high grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took Dr. Van Horne for ANTH 3315 and it was a very easy class. Only graded by 15 quizzes (1 per week). He posts study guides for each of the quizzes and each question on the quizzes comes straight from the study guide. As long as you take the time to watch the lectures and do the study guides, this class is an easy A.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Bases quiz grades off of whether he "thinks" you understand the content or not, not based on satisfactory answers given through the literature he provides. Seems a bit pompous that he assumes you should know what his ideal answer would be, given we are not mind readers and all...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I took ANTH 1102 with Professor Van Horne in the Spring 2020 semester and while I did receive an A, I wouldn't recommend the class for anyone who doesn't want to put their 100% into the class. The class is very lecture heavy and he only gives 3 tests. During our semester, COVID-19 made the class much easier and he made 2 of the tests open note.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: There are only 3 tests for the whole course. No attendance, homework, or quizzes to cushion your grade. I wouldn't recommend this class for first-year students like I was. I also wouldn't recommend it if you're not a great note-taker. The teaching style didn't really help me learn at all. He was kinda funny but that's pretty much it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: The material is interesting and the lectures were engaging, but the grading was rough. There were only three tests and they each cover a lot of information. You have to really put in the effort on each test in order to get an A because one bad test grade and you are stuck with a B or C. As long as you are okay with not making an A I recommend him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a good professor, but the only grades are 3 tests. That's it. And the tests were pretty difficult.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Attendance is not mandatory but you need to know the material for the tests. There are only 3 tests in the course so you NEED to study and complete the readings. He is very straight forward with his lectures and reviews whats to be expected on the tests. Overall, he's a good professor.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: There are only 3 grades in the whole class. No homework, no quizzes, no way to practice your knowledge. You have to study your notes for the past month and a half which is a bit hard. The lectures are very interesting & Professor Van Horne is very knowledgeable but its hard to study for the tests. Good class & professor but horrible grading system.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I loved his lectures and that the readings were online. Don't like that he only grades based on 3 tests. The tests were 30 questions so when you get 4 wrong you already have a B. He reviews the test with us, would recommend recording him because he talks very fast. He doesn't use D2L. Attendance is non-mandatory but you have to go to class to pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. was very clear about the whole semester. The whole class is based on 3 test. I failed one (the second test is the hardest test) and ended up failing the entire class. I wouldn't take him unless you're ready to read and actually are interested in anthropology. He tells you what's going to be on the test, but some of it doesn't even help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I'm a psych major and took this for gen ed, and I absolutely loved it! He's a good lecturer and has clear expectations for the class. It's a LOT of information, but tests don't go into minute details. He also brings skulls and models to class so you can see differences between species, which are really cool to see!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Van Horne is to the point, punctual, and an effective teacher. He is knowledgeable and doesn't rely on power points to do the teaching. Def need to take good notes since exams are based on lectures. No textbook, no attendance (you need to go for notes), 3 exams make up grade. Easy, but still need to study hard.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He is a really great teacher who knows what he is talking about. He is extremely intelligent and seems to really enjoy what he does. He is very understanding and I would definitely recommend him as a professor.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: His class is lecture heavy but he does so in a way that it's interesting. He has a very detailed syllabus with everything dated and planned out. Provides links for all the readings (no textbook). The class is non-mandatory in that he doesn't take attendance. It's all on you whether you want to go and learn the material or not. Only three exams.
rating_tags: Respected--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Only 3 exams and you have to study hard. He tells you what to study but half of them aren't on the exam.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very interesting class and a very reasonable professor. 3 test, all pretty easy. He  literally tells you exactly what's going to be on the test. Excellent professor, I would definitely take him again. He is a really nice and caring guy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: He is a great professor and really knows his stuff. He lectures on fascinating topics. He is funny, but take this class seriously. There are only three grades. Those are all the tests, so make sure to pay attention and study. The textbook is online, so you don't have to worry about buying one. Make sure to print the pages, it really helps.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: There are only three exams and they are no more than 35 questions each so you have to know the material. If you simply go to class and take notes, you will pass. Don't take if you're gonna skip! Awesome lectures so class is enjoyable and he usually ends class early anyway

Professor Van Horne Is An Awesome Professor. He's One Of The Best Professors I've Taken Since I've Been In College. His Class Is Very Straight Forward. Go To Class Everyday, Take Notes, Read & You Will Definitely Get An "A". No Gimmicks. He's Awesome.

Not a terrible professor, but could be a lot better. Very straight forward class. 3 tests, no final, no other grades. Lectures rarely go the full class time, but there is a lot of information on each test. Write down everything, and read online readings. 2nd test is the hardest. Study study study!

Van Horne is wonderful. Great lectures but you must be there to hear them. Works with students and regularly lets class out early. Doesn't seek to waste his students time. Class before test is review in which he flips through the book and tells you exactly what you need to read. Tests are multiple choice/one essay. All you need to do it listen.

Van Horne is hands down my favorite professor at KSU. You can tell he's very passionate about what he does and he portrays that in class. Lectures are old school, on a projector, but I enjoyed his teaching style. No book needed but you have to read articles. Holds a review the class before the test which helps a lot.

I took him for a four week summer session and the classes were long, but he took a break during lectures and was super laid back. Loves to answer questions and will point you in the right direction if he doesn't know an answer. If you study and take notes, you'll do fine!

4 week summer class: Easy A! Final grade was average of 3 tests. No textbook required, all material online (save $), lectures were intense. Provides study guide and literally told us EXACTLY what was on the test. Approachable, truthful, overall great guy, well educated in Anthropology, answered all questions to the best of his ability.

Dr. Van horne is amazing! As long as you do the readings, it's not hard to get a good grade. His lectures are interesting. If you do poorly on the tests that's your own fault because he tells you exactly what to study.

Amazing class. Only three tests for your grade, and he tells you exactly what will be on them. Allows you to record him , which is great since all tests are lecture based. His stories were always interesting and his presentation skills are awesome. Attendance is not required, but highly recommend since you don't want to miss anything for the tests.

Hard for a core class. Three tests and the average is your final grade. Overwhelming amount of material for short tests. he tells you what's going to be on the test but it doesn't help. Does't take attendance but if you don't go you'll fail. no extra credit whatsoever. talks too fast in lectures. no book just a website with lots of articles to read

An amazing old school professor that made this class interesting . He is very knowledgeable and makes everything easy to understand. This was not a class in my major but I still remember the things her taught. If you show up to class and take notes, he will outline what part of the notes to study. Just study and read and you'll be fine.

He is pretty friendly, but talks a lot and does not slow down. He expects for you to look, listen, and write all at the same time and there is a lot to  read on your own time. He reviews for test by telling us what to study, but also says what not to study. No book required. A lot of  students weren't doing too well in this class. Try not to take.

Professor Van Horne is an amazing professor who is passionate about what he teaches. I took his course over the second half of the summer. I enjoyed it so much I was actually sad when it was over. He does not just read off a power point; he teaches the material by thoroughly explaining it in a manner that it is possible to take copious notes.

I took this class for may semester. Be prepared to hike hike hike, if you do not like outdoors do not take this class. 1 presentation, final exam, and a 4 page paper easy to get an A if you read listen and do the work. take good notes.

Only three tests. Got 2 As and 1 B. Great lecturer - clear and concise. Very interesting subject matter. Tests are easy if you take great notes and pay attention in class. Will help you understand subject matter outside of class but does not re-do grades. Review days are very important because subject matter of tests are discussed. Find partners.

Very nice professor. No textbook required and no attendance either. Obviously very interested in and passionate about the topic. However, test questions seem too in depth for basic level class. Nearly all test questions have "all of the above" and "none of the above" to trick you. 3 exams all multiple choice, only grades in class. Very nice guy.
I have taken 5 classes of his and he is outstanding in every one!

Loved Van Horne! Really knowledgeable and passionate. Material gets a little boring in the middle of the class, but hardly his fault. Great lecture skills. No textbook--all online free. No final, just three tests. Attendance not mandatory. Definitely plan on taking him in the future if I can! Loved him!!

Very clear and precise on the material he covers in class. His tests are kind of difficult because they cover a lot of information.  Keep up with the online readings. It's nearly impossible to cram all the information the night before the test. Only 3 Exams. No homework.

Very passionate professor. You can tell he really enjoys what he teaches. His passion makes you want to attend class. Unfortunately, there are only 3 tests so go to class and skim through the reading notes and a B is easy an A is attainable. no textbook :)

I found his lectures absolutely fascinating and vital for success in the class. Unfortunately, there are only three tests for the entire semester so there's little room for error. No textbooks to be purchases (yay!) but GO TO CLASS!

This professor is a great storyteller. He makes the class interesting with his teaching style and he's funny and has a cool and calm personality. You have to take a lot of notes but he tells stories in a way that makes taking notes easy. The class is not that hard if you just listen and take good notes. I got a B and I learned a lot of good info.

EASY A! Just come to class and take good notes, he reviews the class before the test, tells you exactly what is on the tests(matching, true and false, mult. choice 1 essay) 3 tests I've made a 90 and 100 on them so far and I am not a straight A student! Very approachable and lets you record his lectures, which I beleived helped me tremendously!

Dr. Van Horne is AWESOME, he's funny, nice and a great professor! No textbook, 3 tests (multiple choice, matching, t/f, 1 essay..I got a 100 on the test we just took!)Come to class, listen and take good notes. He reviews the class before the test make sure you write down what he says! He let's you record the lectures and is very easy to talk to.

Honestly, I took this class hoping for an easy A. I'm a good student, never gotten under a B, but I struggled for my 80. Take EXTREMELY detailed notes and ALWAYS attend class. Don't really need the textbook, tests are straight from lectures. Again, you MUST come to class. 30 oftentimes obscure questions/test that make it easy to bomb

Good professor. Lectures all class so take good notes and don't be absent!! Only gave 3 tests which were short and EXTREMELY detailed - hard to remember the details when so much information is covered on each test. I came to every class, took excellent notes and studied super hard but still made a B. Oh well, I learned A LOT and love anth now.
TAKE NOTES! He's a good guy and a decent professor, but some test questions were obscure. Take detailed notes and you'll make an A. Try not to miss class.

I took this class VERY begrudgingly, and ended up really enjoying it. He is very knowledgeable on the subject and his enthusiasm makes it interesting. You have to attend class to keep up. I didn't read any chapters because he tells you exactly what will be on the test, including page numbers. Great teacher, easy A if you put forth any effort.

I have had him for 3 classes so far and enjoyed every one. His classes are ALL lecture though so don't expect to skip class and then do well on the exams. His lectures are very intriguing however. COME TO CLASS AND TAKE NOTES!! do this and an A is EASY :) also, he does not use vista for anything so don't expect to see anything posted on there.

This class was great. I had it early, but it always intrigued me. There's tons of information, but he goes over what the test specifically covers the day before. Very knowledgeable, has a sense of humor, and makes things decently easy to understand.

You will work hard for the B or C. Class consists of him talking for an hour straight. You MUST take GREAT notes or know someone that does. The day before the test he goes over the information in the book that you will need for the test. He expects you know love and know anthology as much as he does.  Boring class.

Very straightforward and explanatory. Offers to help, but didn't seem very helpful. Starts out difficult, but ends easy. Got a full letter grade higher than I expected. Somewhat easy b, difficult A. Easy C.
If you want a halfway easy B, don't take this course.

I had this professor for my first Anthropology class and I loved him! He is a great and brilliant professor and can answer any questions you have. His test are based on lectures and the readings but he goes over what's going to be on the test. I would very much recommend him! I might even change my minor to Anthropology!

Phenominal teacher! I took this class as part of my general ed, and ended up changing my major because of it! You will definitely need the book, and definitely need to come to class as his notes are detailed and extensive. Fascinating information and he is available to answer any and all question that you may have!

Endless lecture notes and most of them are pointless. Half the test comes straight from parts of the book he tells you to read the class before the test and they all run together unless you give a crap about 2 page ethnographies on random tribes. Nice guy but don't take this class if you want an easy B or C.

Fantastic professor! Crystal clear, very interesting, the time in his class really flies by! Wasn't initially very interested in the class, but now it's my favorite! Attendance not mandatory, but recommended as his class is very heavily lecture based.

I was a student in the first Environmental Anthro class taught by Van-Horne during Maymester 2010. I am a senior and he is the best lecturer that I have ever had for a class. His difference is that he is not only passionate about the subject, but he can relate that spirit to the student as well. FYI- Be prepared to hike your butt off in the field!

The course itself and what he wants is very clear. He gives excellent and informative lectures. Be prepared for lots and lots and lots of note taking, and long classes of lecture. Attendance is not mandatory, but you'll miss the notes if you don't come.

I had Dr. Van Horne for 4 classes, all of which I've enjoyed. The lectures are great! Attend class, since that's where most of the test comes from. If you can't, get good notes. The tests are usually multiple choice and matching - read the questions carefully. He's helpful, but catch him after class or set up an appointment if you want to talk.

Dr. VanHorne's class is great! His lectures were like stories. He's very clear and interesting. The tests were based straight off the lectures.Tests are multiple choice and matching, not tricky at all. Don't miss a class though or you miss a lot of notes.

Dr. VanHorne was the most boring person I have ever known in life. This semester was way longer than it had to be. His class is crystal clear in terms of what he wanted; its pretty simple 3 tests and thats it.But the pain you have deal with is almost unbearable. i suggest rotating attendance with a buddy and just copying the notes.

Took summer semester - great class! Tests are easy, he does a review the class period before covering all you need to know from the notes/book. Even provides the essay question. I didn't think the class was boring at all. He has a good sense of humor. Not much reading, 3 noncumulative tests. Most test material comes from lectures. Take good notes.
Perfect! Test are easy, he is always there to help. Wonderful and extremely knowledgeable.
Your pillow will need a pillow. How can you make a class like this BORING? Lectures are dry as yesterday's turkey. Tests are very hard.
Three Tests over specific book chapters and lectures. Go to lectures, take notes and recordings, read book chapters. He tells you EXACTLY whats going to be on the tests so study that stuff.

Great teacher, but his test are tricky.  He says they are not, but they are.  Most of the class got C's.  The class seems easy, but because of the way he grades (three tests, no paper, doesn't cruve an inch) and the tricky questions, it's not.  Go to every class, read the book, take lots of notes, & ask lots of questions.  Very intresting lectures.
I took two classes with Dr Van Horn, both of which were really interested.  He got me interested in the subject, in which I'm now a grad student.  Interesting reads and easy tests.

Great teacher, everything he taught was on the test.  Went through with a great review session before the tests, and went over everything you would need to know.  I really enjoyed this class. There was only two tests and no homework.
easy class. must take good notes and go to class. made it interesting.

I took his cultural diversity in the us over the summer, and it was one of my favorite classes ever. his lectures are interesting, he always let us out early and gave good breaks (the classes were  supposed to be 2hr, 45 min but never lasted that long), and i made As on all his tests, and only studied for a couple of hours the day of. if you take decent notes and go through and scan the pages that he give you for the test, you'll definately make an A. some test questions are confusing, but mostly easy!

He's a very nice and easy-going guy. He gives great examples. Study your notes and especially material from the book. Watch out because grading is based on only two tests, so if you don't do good on the first one consider dropping the course!
These are all good evaluations. Take good notes, don't miss class, read the book.  3 tests make up grade. Not too difficult, very interesting!

Very helpful, clear and knowledgeable. Good professor, straight-forward. Half test info based on his lecture + videos, do NOT miss a class! Other half based on text, he tells you exactly which pgs. beforehand. Easy A for me.

Dr. VanHorne is through. Your grade is based on 2-3 tests depending on the class. However, he spends an entire class period prior to test day going over what to study for. In fact, he tells the class not only what to study, but what page to find it on! Come on people how much easier do you want it?

You must take thorough notes during lectures.  Interesting class, but grade is only based on two tests.  Tests are multiple choice and matching, but sometimes tricky.  He knows what he is talking about!  Not an easy "A".

You must attend every class and take thorough notes.  Thankfully the lectures are incredibly interesting. On a side note...he never looks at anyone during the lecture, just scans the back wall continuously.

Midterm and final exams only!You better write fast for his lectures, he won't slow down even if you ask.I had a broke right arm but he didnt care (right handed)..anyways, i made a B in the class but it's easy to fail or do bad if you don't study.Readbook!

Tests are tough if you are not good at matching, and multiple choice section is designed to trip you up. Very knowledgeable, but way too much info for the grade to be based solely on 2 tests. Easy to pass, but difficult to get an A (or even a B).
Knows his stuff.  Lectures are good.  Don't miss class and take notes to pass.  Exams are tough but good measure of knowledge.  Most interesting class so far!
Great teacher! His lectures are interesting.  His tests are a bit hard but he gives you all the info you need to prepare for them.

He is a smart person with a strong sense of knowledge of the topics discussed. His exams are great and he lets you know what to study because he knows what is important. The videos are great and the lectures are actually interesting. :-)
No Comments
